intro: Hymenoxys ursina, commonly known as the bear's milk plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypsela. Hymenoxys ursina is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
